lines.text: Do you own a video camera?
No. Fred hates them.
I like to remember things my own way.
What do you mean by that?
How I remembered them. Not necessarily the way they happened.
We've met before, haven't we.
I don't think so. Where was it you think we met?
At your house. Don't you remember?
No. No, I don't. Are you sure?
Of course. As a matter of fact, I'm there right now.
What do you mean? You're where right now?
At your house.
That's fucking crazy, man.
Call me. Dial your number. Go ahead.

[to a tailgater after running him off the road]
Don't tailgate! Don't you fucking ever tailgate! Do you know how much space is needed to stop a car traveling at 35 miles per hour? Six car lengths! Six fuckin' car lengths! That's a hundred and six fuckin' feet, mister! If I had to stop suddenly, you woulda hit me! I want you to get a fuckin' driver's manual, and I want you to study that motherfucker! And I want you to obey the the goddamn rules of the road! Fifty-fuckin' thousand people were killed on the highways last year 'cause of fuckin' assholes like you! Tell me you're gonna get a manual!
Fucker gets more pussy than a toilet seat.
I'm really glad to know you're doin okay. You're *sure* you're okay? Everything alright?
Yeah?
I'm really glad to know you're doin good, Pete. Hey, I want you to talk to a friend of mine.
We've met before, haven't we?
I don't think so. Where is it you think we've met?
At your house. Don't you remember?
No. No, I don't.

In the East, the Far East, when a person is sentenced to death, they're sent to a place where they can't escape, never knowing when an executioner may step up behind them, and fire a bullet into the back of their head.
What's going on?
It's been a pleasure talking to you.
I want you.
You'll never have me.
[in Pete's vision of Alice]
Did you want to talk to me? Did you want to ask me "WHY"?
Dick Laurent is dead...
Call Me. Dial your number. Go ahead.
[Fred dials the number and the Mystery Man answers]

[over the phone]
I told you I was here.

[amused]
How'd you do that?
Ask me.
[Fred's facial expression turns from amused to serious as he's clearly rembering the anonymous video tapes]

[angrily into the phone]
How did you get inside my house?

[voice]
You invited me. It is not my custom to go where I am not wanted.

[into the phone]
Who are you?
[Both Mystery Men laugh mechanically]

[voice]
Give me back my phone.
[Fred gives the cell phone back to the man in front of him]
It's been a pleasure talking to you.
Man, that wife killer looks pretty fucked up.
Which one?
[both laugh]

[singing]
Funny how secrets travel...
[repeated line]
We've met before, haven't we?
Where's Alice?
Alice who? Her name is Renee. If she's told you her name is Alice, she's lying.
[filled with rage]

[shouts]
And your name? What the fuck is your name?
What a fucking job.
His or ours, Lou?
Ours, Hank.
How you doin' Pete?
Okay.

I'm sure you noticed that girl that was with me the other day, good lookin' blonde? She stayed in the car? Her name is Alice. I swear I love that girl to death. If I ever find out that somebody was making out with her, I'd take this...
[pulls out a .357 pistol]
...and shove it so far up his ass it would come out of his mouth. Then you know what I'd do?
What?
I'd blow his fuckin' brains out.
[Mr. Eddy puts his gun away]
Hey, you're looking good. What you been up to?
Captain Luneau?
Yeah, Mack?
Captain, this is some spooky shit we got here.
Do you know what I think?
What is it? What is it that you think?
There is no such thing as a bad coincidence.
[into a phone]
There's nine people down here, and you can ask seven of them. If you can get that price from one of them, I'll let you ask the other two.
What do you want?
Wanna go for a drive?

[coyly]
I don't know.
Get in, baby.
You're a musician?
Yeah.
What's your axe?
Tenor. Tenor saxophone. Do you...

[shakes his head and point at his ear]
Tone deaf.
Andy, who is that guy?
I don't know his name. He's a friend of Dick Laurent's, I think.
Dick Laurent?
Yeah, I believe so.
But Dick Laurent is dead, isn't he?
This is where mechanical excellence and one-thousand four-hundred horsepower pays off.
Who the hell owns that dog?
I had a dream about you last night.
Yeah? What was it about?
You were in the house, calling my name, but I couldn't find you. Then there you were, lying in bed... but it wasn't you. It looked like you, but it wasn't.
How did you meet that asshole Andy, anyway?
It was a long time ago. I met him at this place called Moke's. We... became friends. He told me about a job...
What job?
Ah... I don't remember. Anyway, Andy's okay.
Yeah well, he's got some fucked-up friends.
Where the fuck are we going, Alice?
We have to go to the desert, baby.
Pete! Where've you been? It's really good you're back! A lot of people are gonna be happy that you're back, including me!
Well, it's good to be back, Arnie.
Mr. Smith is waiting for you.
Sure, I'll take care of him.
And Mr. Eddy called every day asking about you. Can I call him and tell him to come in?
Sure, call him. Tell him to come in and I'm ready to work.
You're ready to work?
I'm ready to work.

[to the other garage employees]
Pete is back!
[Pete, disturbed by the saxophone music on a radio, switches the channels]
What'd you change it for? I liked that.
Well, I don't!
I liked that.
The police called us today.
What'd they want?
They wanted to know if we had a chance to find out what happened to you the other night. And they wanted to know if you remembered anything.
But... I don't remember anything. What'd you tell them?

[after a long pause]
We're not going to say anything about that night to the police.
We saw you that night, Pete.
You came home with your friend, Sheila.
Sheila?
Uh-huh. There was a man with you two.
What is this? Why didn't you tell me anything? Who was the man?
I've never seen him before in my life.
What happened to me? Please Dad, if you know, tell me.
[Bill and Candace sorrowfully look away from Pete]
Boy, that's smooth. Smooth as shit off a duck's ass!
[laying on the ground with his throat slashed by Fred and the Mystery Man]

[gagging from his bloody throat]
What do you guys want?

[the Mystery Man pulls out a hand-held Watchman TV and gives it to Mr. Eddy who looks on it to see an interior of Andy's house at night with with Mr. Eddy and Renee watching a snuff-porno film while fondling each other beside the projector. The image suddenly changes back to Fred and the Mystery Man standing before him in the frame]
Now you can hand it back.

[as he hands the portable TV back]
You and me, mister... we can really out-ugly them sonafabitches. Can't we?
